result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Anthony Powless was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and concurrent to any other sentence.  Court grants out-of-county service.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean Anthony Powless

2:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  FTP $218.30.  Court questions defendant regarding payment.  Statement by defendant - will be incarcerated for awhile, can pay once released.  Court cancels the warrant.  Court authorizes a new warrant and stays that pending the defendant paying in full in 60 days or contact the clerk of courts office.  Statement by defendant, is in custody in Waushara County on a cash bond.  Court leaves as is, if defendant is in custody the warrant will not be issued.

Court adjourned at 2:20 p.m.

from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
FTP Hearing 06-20-2016 for $443.00

10:19 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - State will amend to misdemeanor bail jumping.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as amended.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-60 days county jail, with huber and concurrent to any other sentence. Out of county service.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on June 15, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.
